website_summaries.verdict: Many people prefer the dimensions and comfort of a standard toilet seat, and this model is designed to incorporate the original seat into the raised design.
pros: Fits under original toilet seat, not over
cons: Original bolts can rust over time
Does not fit all toilet bowl designs

customer_reviews.title: PRODUCT NOT RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: Note that this product is not returnable. I cannot find where it indicates that in the product description. My husband’s knee surgery is healing faster than expected and we realized that we do not need this product. It never came out of the box, but it does not matter, we are not able to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Penny Potter

customer_reviews.title: Post Op Must!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Are you having hip or back surgery soon or have you already! This is a must! I got it for my husband and it has been amazing. He is able to go to the restroom without assistance. Install was easy. Hardware was included. It doesn't move around like a lot of reviews stated. No issues so far. He has been using it for 7 days and it hasn't budged yet. Husband is 5'7" and 190 lbs. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: there is another one that I ordered where the legs can be adjusted to a great height, and there is NO assembly or crawling ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!....this takes a lot of work to make it 'part' of the toilet; I had to return as it's difficult to remove the toilet seat cover, install this, and then replace the toilet seat cover....there is another one that I ordered where the legs can be adjusted to a great height, and there is NO assembly or crawling on your knees to set it up..
customer_reviews.author: Missy B

customer_reviews.title: Not a Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: This seat was not what I expected. When you went to get up it shifted back & fourth. There was no way to make this 100% sturdy & I felt unsafe using it, so we found a stand to use instead of this add on to the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT WAS POOLY DESIGNED AND DOES NOT FIT THE TOILET WELL
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for an up coming hip surgery. It does not fit the toilet well at all. Whether a man or a women uses it. Any urine that hits the front of the elevated seat follows the contour of the unit down to the edge of the bowl then runs over the edge of the the toilet bowl onto the floor. The only reason it gets a one star rating is because I could not give it a zero.
customer_reviews.author: dogster

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 95 year old mom. Had it installed by someone who knows what they are doing. It wasn't a week before it started to slip, making my mother even more unstable because she didn't trust that it wouldn't slip out from under her. Difficult to clean because of the design. I would not recommend this product. Unfortunately we are stuck with this product that now sits in the closet!
customer_reviews.author: Dinapel

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, but seems to please my Dad.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't there for delivery or installation but my nephew figured it out (he drilled a larger hole for the screws) and got this installed just fine. My Dad didn't complain which we both took to be a ringing endorsement. He did brag about it to a neighbor so I guess he likes it fine and it's doing the job as intended. Well, see how easy it is to keep clean as I'm sure my Mom will let me know as time passes whether it is easy or hard to keep it clean. I will say of all of the choices available, this is the most attractive and the handles are a great asset.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Laiuppa

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Could not use. Unsafe for my mom to use because it is unstable. Tried to tighten up more to make more stable but the bolts just forced their way through the cheap plastic washers and into the seat making it even more unsafe. The box and directions had a “catch all” safety statement that says something like “make sure seat is firmly on the toilet to prevent injuries from fall”. Could not return. I don’t know how this company has 4 stars and so many good reviews... I think someone is cooking the books at the costumers expense. Amazon please investigate.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Adds safety and comfort after hip replacement surgery
customer_reviews.text: Right before a recent hip replacement we put this elevated toilet seat on our regular toilet. After the surgery we were so glad we had installed it. Made it much easier to get up and down off the toilet seat, especially with the arms to hold on to while standing back up. The surgery is almost four weeks out now and we will be removing it soon as it is rather difficult to properly clean the toilet with it on, but it is worth the extra trouble to have the added safety and comfort of the higher seat. We would definitely recommend this product for anyone having hip or knee replacement surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not lock tight on toilet
customer_reviews.text: Does not lock tight on the toilet, I tried to make it more stable by buying metal washers and screws and this did not help either, to me it is very unsafe, and if you order it it’s yours, they will not refund your money or take it back, I ordered two because we have two homes, they would not take the one that was unopened back either ! Threw them both in the trash as I would not give them to anyone because of the stability problem!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for post leg surgery. Easy to assemble and install.
customer_reviews.text: Seat comes in easy to open box. Assembly is quick and easy, just need a large flat blade screwdriver. Simply remove existing toilet seat. Put bolts in bag, label them and store them away until you are done using elevated seat. Two side arm braces simply slide into tubing on bottom of seat and click in place with buttons. Install elevated seat on toilet, put existing toilet seat on top of elevated seat. Insert bolts through both seats, and secure seat by putting washers/nuts on bottom of bolts, tighten with large flat blades screwdriver. I used this after hip surgery, and the extra 5" of height made it much easier to use the toilet. Good quality. Fair price.
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money and get this elevated toilet seat that bolts to the toilet and uses your existing toilet seat.
customer_reviews.text: Much more comfortable than elevated toilet seats that do not use your toilet seat. Much more stable than "quick install" elevated toilet seats because it actually bolts to the toilet. I started out with a "quick install" elevated toilet seat for hip replacement surgery. I replaced the "quick install" unit after one use with this unit and felt it was an excellent decision.
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Normal

customer_reviews.title: Cheap hardware and a manufacturer that doesn't care...
customer_reviews.text: This would be great if they just included some better hardware and several options. Just like allthe reviews. I fought with this thing for quite a while. Cheap hardware made in China ruins every product that is reasonably priced. Until the hardware is connected, I recommend going to your local medical supply and speaking to an associate that knows what they are talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really elongated and not even good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our elongated toilet, and it was not long enough. This resulted in an unpleasant buildup between the plastic and the porcelain which could only be remedied by removal of the seat and riser and vigorous scrubbing. In addition, the plastic cracked on the front right side in less than a year. This is from use by 2 people who weigh 100 and 160 pounds each. Only things I could recommend were the handles. As soon as the new hinged toilet seat riser I ordered arrived, this one went into the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerlily

customer_reviews.title: Helped with spouse's hip replacement recovery
customer_reviews.text: Good product, however cleaning is an issue. You have to disconnect it from the toilet bowl and take it apart so there are no to adjacent parts in order to clean it. That means a phillips screwdriver, plus whatever tool used to disconnect it from the bowl. Cleaned mine with a strong water/bleach solution, but wasn't able to remove all of the urine stains. Recommend at least a monthly cleaning to prevent smells.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Overall, very good riser seat
customer_reviews.text: Very nice seat. I like that you can take one handle off if you want. The trouble that we ran into is that though the handles are removeable, the button to do the removing is underneath hidden between the eleveated seat and the original top of the toilet bowl. So, you would have to unscrew it to get at the buttons- not something you can do everytime you want to use it. We need follow the directives of another that said to use RUBBER washers and that is essential and worked well. It was very easy to put on and has been very useful.
customer_reviews.author: VTS

customer_reviews.title: It also makes a good cleaning very difficult without taking it off and putting ...
customer_reviews.text: This works for a temporary fix or situation. Our need is likely long term. After 3 mos of use, we have replaced with entire standard toilet with elevated toilet and full time rails. Although this met the individuals need, it was in a bathroom that others also used and of limited comfort for those who are "wide". It would also become loose after a few weeks and required tightening again. It also makes a good cleaning very difficult without taking it off and putting it back on. Additionally, the material the area under the seat was beginning to indent where toilet seat pads sat. Would likely not hold up more than another 3mos. Adequate if your need is short term.
customer_reviews.author: JasonPsyD

customer_reviews.title: The perils of one size fits all.
customer_reviews.text: As far as the materials and construction I would have no problems to give this seat five stars. The rub is that they tried to make a seat that would fit any type of toilet. Their solution was to make the mounting holes elongated to account for the variations in dimensions. Consequently, you cannot make the seat rigid to the toilet no matter how much you tight the bolts. Actually, you have to be careful not to squash the plastic or the original seat. The result is that the seat is wobbly. It is not dangerous and it helps a person with disabilities but you have to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Algesoft

customer_reviews.title: Will need modifications for stability.
customer_reviews.text: It slides all over the place. We will need to be purchasing some sort of rubber tape to increase security. This product is practically a death trap. Even with safety bars. Unfortunately could not return item. Washers could stand to be a bit larger as well. It's unfortunate enough that people need something like this without adding insult to injury, and that surely has multiple contexts in this case. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Not returnable very unstable could have caused my wife a lot of pain just had hip joint replacement
customer_reviews.text: No we're in item description does it say not returnable also it is very unstable and caused my wife a lot of pain when it shifted around. The bottom line is don't buy this poorly made product buy the one that can also double as a shower seat.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: STOP
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. I purchased it for my 95 year old mother and the bolts didn't tighten well (she has a handyman for these tasks) and urine somehow kept getting under it. She said the odor was horrifying. Her cousin also had purchased a similar one and had the same problem. The simple solution is to put a portable potty chair over the toilet. Trust me. We went through several designs and found that to be the easiest remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Thornton

customer_reviews.title: A great help
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a great amount of knee pain and getting up from the toilet was difficult and scary because of fall risks. While waiting for the knee procedures, this helps her a great deal; and will help after surgery during recovery. She no longer feels like she may topple over when rising from the toilet and the strain on her knees is markedly reduced. I got a big kiss for installing this for her. It was straight forward to install and when no longer needed it will be just as simple to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Windsock

customer_reviews.title: Good option for hip replacement recovery
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the recovery after hip replacement surgery. I’m 6’5” so needed a solid elevated seat with handles. Easy to install and worked as hoped. Seat is comfortable and handles are secure and help with limited mobility. The seat opening was smaller than our existing seat but not bad.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this over other styles of elevated toilet seats. I purchased a different model and it did not last. So far this seems durable, but time will tell. You an use your regular toilet seat with it, which is nice. The handles are adjustable in width too. The only down side is that it comes with metal fasteners. I would suggest getting plastic screws and bolts. I picked them up at my local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: FS

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter has a cracked vertabra and was having trouble using a low toilet. We ordered this riser and it arrived very promptly. I installed it as soon as it arrived. The side handles were a little stiff to insert into the seat, but I got them in with a little effort. The very long screws that were provided worked quite well. I was able to tighten the seat so that it is very stable. I will be able to remove it when she is better and no longer needs the added height. I would recommend this for anyone who needs a higher seat.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Prof

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for use after a hip replacement. Was very nervous after reading reviews on some other products but this was very sturdy and safe. I thought the extra height would be very beneficial. As it turned out, I could use lower toilets. The toilets in the hospital were certainly lower. The most important part turned out to be the support of the hand rails. These were perfect because they are built into the structure of the seat so I felt confident that I would be safe using it.
customer_reviews.author: lunachick

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: There is a no return policy, so there was no way to test this first. The holes in the back are elongated, so that the screws move around and constantly need to be re-tightened. Also, if you have a seat with easy-clean clips, you will not be able to use your existing seat. I had to go buy a whole new one with the cheap holes so it would work. The handles were so uncomfortable, I took them off and just used it for being slightly elevated. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: OK, if that is what you want.
customer_reviews.text: This was a more permanent fix than we were looking for. It would suite someone who is crippled and it, of course, is cheaper than installing a new toilet. We only needed a higher very soft seat for a short time due to a fractured pelvis. The unit was not returnable but three cheers to the company for refunding our money and we donated it to a home healthcare dept. of the state hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Bideford

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt hook it to toilet and couldn't find a toilet ...
customer_reviews.text: Couldnt hook it to toilet and couldn't find a toilet seat to hook it too. UNREFUNDABLE SO ITS SITTING ON A SHELK until hopefully some day we'll run into a seat that it fits onto. MEAN while my 92 year old mother has to deal with getting up and down from our current handicap toilet seat. Really really discouraged!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A game changer!
customer_reviews.text: I had been unable to easily get up from a normal toilet because leg issues. I had to pull myself up holding the adjacent door frame. With this elevated seat of added height and 2 arms, it's a snap. I literally slide right off to a standing position. Best of all, it uses my own comfortable toilet seat, unlike others that do not. After reading reviews about wobbling and sliding, I had my plumber install it. I don't know what he did, but he's an expert with all kinds of tools. My elevated toilet is as steady as can be. Next to my recliner, it's the best seat in the house!
customer_reviews.author: B.Gee

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for anyone with non weight bearing issues
customer_reviews.text: It is narrow and tiny. There is barely room to sit, forget about the ability to clean yourself after unless you can stand up. I am supposed to be non weight bearing on one foot - this is completely unworkable. Would not recommend for anyone with non weight bearing issues.
customer_reviews.author: Judith

customer_reviews.title: VERY STURDY
customer_reviews.text: Arms on a chair are most important to my Dad being able to stand up and get out of a chair. There were many very nice elevated toilet seats, as well as some that were part of the toilet itself, but no arms. He is very happy with this seat, and it was especially helpful because he's 6ft tall. THE ONLY ISSUE we had with this seat was that the bolts holding it to the the porcelain bowl were not long enough and had to be jury rigged.
customer_reviews.author: GranAuntie

customer_reviews.title: Disaster Waiting to Happen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this seat for my mother with Alzheimer's. Despite multiple attempts to tighten the bolts, it would not mount firmly on the bowl and was extremely unstable and dangerous. There was no way to secure the front of the seat to the front of the bowl so it slides back and forth and is very unsteady. We purchased one that has a screw that you twist to clamp the seat to the front of the bowl. A much better design.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wolanski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and provides a firm base
customer_reviews.text: The higher seat makes it easier for a person to transfer from a wheelchair to the toilet and back again. Assembly is simple and installation is nothing more than removing and reinstalling the existing toilet seat. I find it necessary to tighten the screws every few days just as I tighten the normal seats every few months.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Durney

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat is very difficult and time consuming to remove and clean. It needs to be re-engineered. Perhaps the bolts should be made of a corrosion resistant material such as plastic along with shorter bolts/ Six inches is way way too long. There is virtually no way to contact EssentialMedical supply company for help. Returns, understandably are not accepted. I am disappointed that Amazon would sell something as deficient as this toilet seat riser. Not recommended at all
customer_reviews.author: Keydet61

customer_reviews.title: Built for men in mind.
customer_reviews.text: After having hernia surgery on my left groin, I could not sit down on a regular toilet. This model is elliptical in shape and fits perfectly on an elliptical toilet. It raises the seat approximately 4 inches, which makes it easier to sit and stand, and the arm rest helps you achieve an up-right position. With the swelling that comes along with the surgery, a man needs an elliptical shape in order to be able to "tuck" in order to sit. I liked this so much that I purchased two more and donated them to an organization that supplies hospital equipment for free for those in need. Yes, I highly recommend this model of seat.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Abell

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and works well
customer_reviews.text: It does add quite a bit of height. The handles are wonderful. I would suggest that you measure your toilet and make sure that this will work with your height. I am 5’3” and my feet barely touch the ground. However, my husband installed a tall toilet to mount it to. Quality and I’m glad I have it. Perfect for hip replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Caribouwoman

customer_reviews.title: UNSANITARY- NO WAY TO CLEAN URINE THAT ACCUMULATES UNDER UNIT WITHOUT TOTALLY REMOVING UNIT
customer_reviews.text: WHEN THE UNIT IS ATTCCHED TO THE TOILET....YOU CAN NOT LIFT IT TO CLEAN THE URINE AND OTHER MATTER THAT SEEPS BETWEEN IT AND THE TOILET BASE....... GROSS... UNSANITARY..... ONLY WAY TO CLEAN IS TO LOOSEN THE TWO MOUNTING SCREWS!!!! UNIT IS REASONABLY EASY TO INSTALL BUT IT IS VIRTUALLY IMPOSSIBLE TO TIGHTEN THE TWO SCREWS TIGHT ENOUGH TO STOP IT FROM SHIFTING BACK AND FORTH
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would not buy again no refund avaible
customer_reviews.text: I did not read the review before buying - if it does not work no refund or return. the plastic has no lips on it to keep it in place - plastic on ceramic does not work!!! I have put sticky grips strips on the bottom and between the seat - and rubber grommits between the seat and riser and between riser and ceramic and on the bottom by the wing nut. I have to keep tighten the bolts weekly then do not stay tight. Handles are good and husband likes the height and handles and easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have the equivalent of a broken back and my upcoming back surgery has me buying whatever will help me now and after my June surgery. This is pretty easy to put together. My only issue with the whole thing is that the screws loosen up several times a day. I don’t know if it’s just my toilet or if it’s the seat elevator itself. I have no problem tightening the screws now but it might become an issue after major back surgery
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaRN

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT COME with a TOILET SEAT
customer_reviews.text: WARNING- Despite images and title description "Essential Medical Supply Elevated Toilet Seat with Arms, Elongated" this product DOES NOT COME with a toilet seat. Only the riser, side bars and metal screws. 2nd WARNING- This item is NOT RETURNABLE to Amazon (I tried 6/19/2020). I chatted with an amazon representative and was graciously given a full refund and told I could despose of this brand new item (that is unusable to me without a metal screwed seat attached to the riser).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Elevated Toilet Seat
customer_reviews.text: Totally unusable for me. It did not fit my toilet. I had surgery, was in the hospital & a rehab center. By the time I came home you refused to allow me to return it. The time frame was not my fault. You refused to allow me to return the item. It has never been used either!! PLEASE reconsider & allow me to return this item. I am a Senior citizen on a fixed income. Returning it would be so very helpful to me. TY
customer_reviews.author: Mims

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This product is well designed and even better than what I expected. We had to remove the toilet seat, place it on top of the device, bolt it down using the 2 bolts provided, and it worked perfectly. My dad uses it and he is so pleased with it, I bought a second one. Prior to that he used a bedside commode over the toilet. Even with an added cushion on the bedside commode, this device is a major improvement in comfort, appearance and function than the bedside commode.
customer_reviews.author: lrnbsn

customer_reviews.title: It was a big help
customer_reviews.text: Very useful after my mother's hip replacement. Simple attachment to the toilet bowl. You should push up with a hand on each of the two handles, otherwise it will wobble (not fall over, but wobble enough to cause an unsteady person to be more unsteady).
customer_reviews.author: Lady Lawyer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Had a recent surgery and had to purchase this and it works great I like that your regular toilet seat bolts onto it directly so you can change the design or anything by changing your regular toilet seat. Also that it is not the soft foam like so many which seem to turn disgusting after a bit. The rails are perfect space apart and work awesome .
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H.

customer_reviews.title: Check to make sure screws to secure to toilet bowl are compatible.
customer_reviews.text: The screws foe my toilet are plastic and the screws for this seat are compatible. My are not. Bought this for my mother when she moves in at the end of October. Unfortunately I did not test this out prior to the renovation. Why didn't I didn't have the toilet yet. Yup poor planning on my part but my mom was more important. Now I am stuck with this seat that I cannot use.....nor can I afford to store a hunk of useless plastic. Oh and if by some off chance it did work with the screws: it wobbled on the toilet. It would wobble every time someone sat down.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: space between this elevator and toilet bowl traps urine & excrement
customer_reviews.text: Haven't found a way to prevent crud from collecting. Without sealant periodic removal of unit for cleaning is in order. Sealing between this unit and toilet bowl leaves exposed sealant and the margins of the sealant to collect crud and need cleaning. Not having found a sufficiently tall toilet this will suffice.
customer_reviews.author: a reviewer

customer_reviews.title: how to clean
customer_reviews.text: to clean this seat, you have to take the long bolts out of each side, which means you have to get on the floor, or bend over a really long time and slowly turn the wing nuts until it reaches the bottom of the bolt. Place seat in the shower, or outside with a hose, scrub and sanitize with brush. If you open it and find it does not fit your commode, even if never used........you are stuck with it.... items like this (personal hygiene ) are not returnable , period.
customer_reviews.author: barbara surface

customer_reviews.title: Life saver, or should I say knee saver
customer_reviews.text: Used this after I had knee surgery and I have to say it was great. Not sure I want to ever take it off.
customer_reviews.author: dana hall

customer_reviews.title: Lots cheaper than a new high toilet and nearly as good
customer_reviews.text: We have two. Make sure to get the bolts tight and retighten in two weeks. Seat stays put well when sitting on it. Can move a little if bumped when empty but minimal. Great to have the height for knee problems or even if no problems. Was considering having new tall toilets installed but this solution works well. We like the handles on the sides too. Installation of the first one took 20 minutes. The second 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Product was never opened or used but it is not returnable. I bought it before starting in-home hospice care. Hospice Nurse determined I am too feeble and unsteady in bathroom to use it safely. Product looks sturdy and would have met my needs if I was more steady on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: gore

customer_reviews.title: NOT RETURNABLE.  Unstable and not wide enough.
customer_reviews.text: Although it doesn’t say so in the product description it is not returnable. So a waste of money. When it is installed as tightly as it can be it still rocks and is unstable. Also, not enough room between the arms for a larger person.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bolts are useless.
customer_reviews.text: Good solution but the bolts are USELESS. They are too thick for any toilet seat. As a result I had to but thinner bolts and it’s less stable than designed. It’s not ready to install unless you are willing to make modifications.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Oppenheim

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy this item
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat riser does not work. My husband had to buy extra length bolts and still the seat does not securely sit without sliding front to back on the toilet base. This is NOT what you need when you have a hip replacement! We threw it away and did not even use it for the few weeks we bought it for. Read the reviews and believe it! Choose another brand or go to your local medical supply! It's not worth injury from an insecure attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetoread

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: Simply remove two screws from your toilet seat and install this in it's place using the two longer screws that come with the product. Once those screws are tightened down this toilet seat will remain tightly fastened to the toilet, thus eliminating any possible accidents. I highly recommend this product and NOT other similar looking toilet seats that DO NOT fasten to the toilet but simply sit on top.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Useless!
customer_reviews.text: Sure it's easy to install, but it's completely useless because it wiggles and wobbles all over the place. Not helpful for my father in law after his triple bypass heart surgery. Unfortunately could not return even though no one ever even sat on this seat attachment. EXTREMELY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: LTMW

customer_reviews.title: Slides around
customer_reviews.text: I tried all of the tips in the reviews but could not get it secure. It slides around so much I would never use it after my knee replacement or even with good knees. I tried the hardware it came with, adding rubber gaskets, etc. It’s not returnable so a waste of money and time.
customer_reviews.author: J. hamaguchi

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.  We bought 3
customer_reviews.text: We ought one of these last week and is delivered the NEXT day. I am 6-2" and weigh 225 pounds and my wife is 150lbs and is 5-4". It only took about 10 minutes to install using only a large flat bladed screwdriver on a Kohler elongated 1.6gal. . Absolutely no modification was necessary! I cannot imagine why a few other people had problems installing this item. We are so impressed, a few minutes ago we ordered two more for our house. And by the way, it was a little more than $50 cheaper than in our local brick-and-mortar store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wiggles around but works
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem with this riser is it is only connected by the two toilet seat bolt holes at the back of the bowl so it shifts back and forth. As long as you tighten the long bolts properly and don’t wiggle around on the seat, it works fine. Other brands have ways to attach around the inside of the bowl which improves stability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my mom because she was falling back on the toilet bue to weak knees. I was worried at first about the handles and weather or the seat would move with her pushing on it. So far it has held in place w/o a problem. I feel safer withe her using it and she has maintained her independence.
customer_reviews.author: Cailan S

customer_reviews.title: A must if having issues getting up and down.
customer_reviews.text: Bought due to recent hip surgery. Was easy to apply to toilet basin. Did not have any problems with it being loose or moving when in use. Does need to be removed to get a good cleaning between the seat and toilet in .used for long-term. Very strong, I am just under 300 pounds and was able to fit between the handles and had no other issues.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Moss

customer_reviews.title: ... with the plastic dial broke my foot on that stupid thing I head to wear a boot for 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: fact I am on the 3rd one now I do not have a choice I cut my leg with the one with the plastic dial broke my foot on that stupid thing I head to wear a boot for 3 months. N0W I have to0 back to this thing and the handles are breaking off I know I* am not that FAT
customer_reviews.author: deik vacum cleanerAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this item does not fit older low rise toilet
customer_reviews.text: this item did not work. I am sure that the description is just wrong for lower/older toilets. Will not fit , not easy to install because screws do not fit -as evidenced by two sets of maintenance men in my building who tried to make it fit for me. I must return this, am calling amazon as I type.
customer_reviews.author: Ali3

customer_reviews.title: Additional height is a plus
customer_reviews.text: Mom is very happy with the seat. The added height definitely improves her ability to stand, the arms are a bonus to keep her independent in the bathroom. Handyman installed. This purchase was a winner.
customer_reviews.author: B. P.

customer_reviews.title: Good To make toilet seat higher, slides around.
customer_reviews.text: It is helpful as a seat raiser and I like the arms on it. It was fairly easy to assemble. The biggest problem is there is no seal to the toilet (which I didn’t realize was so essential till I had it). We tightened the bolts up pretty tight but the seat raiser still slides around a bit on the toilet. I just had hip surgery so it is a little difficult to trust sitting down or getting up from the toilet since it might slide around.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Scalet

customer_reviews.title: Need more washers
customer_reviews.text: Product easy to install. If you plan to use your old toilet seat make sure you have some extra flat washers since the nylon washer supplied is not strong enough to hold the old seat onto the riser. If you do not plan to use your old toilet seat make sure you get at least two 1/4" fender washers because the slots for the bolts are too wide. If you try to use the nylon flat washer it will fold down into this slot when you tighten up the bolt. If product came with two additional 1/4" fender washers it would be easier to install properly.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R.

customer_reviews.title: Assistance for the commode
customer_reviews.text: Found this product after trying a number of assistance seats and like the adjustable width handles, plus it was easy to put together without any tools. Other products go all the way to the floor, which I didn't like. Recommended for anyone needing a little help sitting down and getting up from the commode.
customer_reviews.author: Debra E Brady

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The photo shows that the seat sits higher than 3". Measure, measure, measure. If someone stability isn't that great, I wouldn't recommend this long term. I would say this is a short term aid after surgery. THIS IS NOT RETURNABLE!!! However, Amazon assisted me with a solution that was satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great for older generation
customer_reviews.text: This has been great for my elderly parents who are having difficulty with fall issues and such. This has been extremely helpful for them not like a previous seat that wasn't permanently fixed to the seat. The previous one would pop off when pressure was not evenly distributed by my parents. This one is fixed to the toilet so there is no chance for them falling off the toilet because the seat has shifted.
customer_reviews.author: Kath

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Husband encountered some challenges installing. Other than that, definately serves its purpose. I am 5'7" this brings the seat to the perfect height for me. Support handles are comfortable to grip and strong enough to support the majority of my weight (177 lbs) as I stand up. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danae Sandwell

customer_reviews.title: The handles help
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband, he had a back injury. He said the handles help him stay stable sitting or standing. He also said he has less pain sitting. He is 6' 5" tall so he does not have as far to go when sitting down.
customer_reviews.author: dacc30

customer_reviews.title: Meet Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The Essential Medical Supply Elongated Toilet Seat arrived on time and in good condition. Installation went smoothly except for the need to enlarge the holes in the original toilet seat cover so that the large diameter bolts that came with the new seat could be installed. The original toilet seat cover came with my Kohler toilet and the holes had to be enlarged by drilling. Doing this may not be doable by many elder people.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Toilet helper for after surgery
customer_reviews.text: This works great for me but if your heavy you want the bigger one!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Secure
customer_reviews.text: It is very comfortable-I had my 2nd cervical spine surgery in two months. The height made it much easier to get up
customer_reviews.author: dskulman

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Cannot use this because it's unstable - slides back and forth when someone tries to sit on it. The "ball pins" that pop up to fasten the arm rests protrude and keep the seat from fitting flat onto the rim of the toilet. Even without the armrests, the seat still slides too much to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect after having hip replacement
customer_reviews.text: This is just what was needed after having my hip replacement. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Plastic comfort.
customer_reviews.text: After recently having a below the knee amputation I needed this to help take care of my dirty bathroom business. It makes it so much easier to take the Brown to the Superbowl.
customer_reviews.author: AR shooter

customer_reviews.title: long thick screws won’t work with some toilets - not returnable
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes with all the good reviews but disappointed when I opened the box. One big problem with this seat is the very thick screws that comes with it. It did not work with our toilet and when I tried to return it, at the very last step it says this product is not returnable ! We had to make it work with duct tape for a short time until the new raised seat arrives! I do not recommend this product if this is for after surgery purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: The bowl, supposed to be elongated, isn’t as large as our toilet bowl. That makes the opening small and very uncomfortable. We also found it made the toilet too high for my 86 year old mom. We had no problem with it slipping, the size just makes it awkward.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit elongated toilet and not returnable
customer_reviews.text: It does not fit the elongated toilet and it is not stable once installed. We ordered two; installed one and then removed without using. The other was never removed from the box. We are waiting for a response from Amazon about return since we now discover it is a non returnable item. What a waste of $40 each!
customer_reviews.author: D. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Safe and helpful with broken knee
customer_reviews.text: I broke my knee, I needed to elevate a toilet seat for my safety. The side arms added to the height, so it was easier to hold myself and stand up. It was easy to assemble, easy to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Timea

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t get tight installation
customer_reviews.text: Although I really tried to install it as best as I could, it never did get a tight installation. It moved and slid around a lot when i used it. It is well constructed, but just couldn’t get it tight. The height was perfect. Loved the handles. Just wish it had been stable, because with a non-weightbearing foot, it was tough.
customer_reviews.author: D. McLin

customer_reviews.title: Raised seat
customer_reviews.text: It’s stable, not too hard to put together. I purchased for my spouse for easier use after surgery. Great for anyone who has trouble lowering oneself down on toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: RethaMae

customer_reviews.title: Great for the elderly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly father who has trouble standing up from the regular toilet height. This makes it easier for him to stand and gives him more independence.
customer_reviews.author: B. ANDREWS

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has tendency to loosed up!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 89 year father-in law. It really helps him, however we have to constantly tighten up the screws. Does no seem to matter how tight me make the screws, they loosen up. Seeing that is it for the elderly who need assistance, this is NOT something that should be a concern.
customer_reviews.author: Bananabread

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: The elevated toilet seat attaches to the toilet with two long bolts. Seat wobbles a little, as there is no support on the front edge to attach it to the toilet bowl front edge. Arms are solidly attached to the seat and can be easily removed if needed. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: aebruce

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE!!
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a must have for anyone who needs any help getting up from bed. It is weighted down by the mattress and your body as you rise making you feel more confident about using it. I was surprised how simple it was to put together. Absolutely a great purchase and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my Father especially for night usage. He was loosing balance during late night bathroom trips and this has helped him stay safe and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic Mama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone who needs a toilet riser~back problems, surgical, chronic or acute!
customer_reviews.text: This toilet riser is perfect for anyone who needs a “lift!” If your preparing for a surgical procedure, have back problems etc.. This riser was a must have for me. Six months post-op I can say that it was a necessity for me to have this piece of DME. It was very easy to assemble and easy to clean. Affordable and easy to store for your future needs!
customer_reviews.author: L. Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Plastic washers are useless.
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the plastic washers that are provided prevent you from tightening it down where it doesn't slide. The plastic ones start to collapse which make them useless for tightening the bolts properly to keep seat from sliding.
customer_reviews.author: dennis

customer_reviews.title: It is a good tool to assist an elder but hard to properly clean
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it is me but mine is not to stable, it does not covers the porcelain bowl it is a bit smaller then the original bowl. It is hard to clean under the plastic seat specially with a older male. Some how the urine gets between the plastic seat and the porcelain bowl rim . It is messy !!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Sobba

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is great but, it isn’t very secure. Only the two bolts in the back holding it to the toilet. When my mom sat on it I had to hold the chair so it wouldn’t slide. Once she was down it was fine. Just use a little caution.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Nickles

customer_reviews.title: fails under use by 160 pound person after several months use.
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to install and stable and has been serviceable for many months, however now is failing due to the toilet seat supports punching through the top shell of the support. This has happened on both sides of the seat. I first noticed a slight impression in the top of the support a month or so ago and now it has punched completely through. I will have to replace it but am going with another manufacturer. The patient using it only weighs 160 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Collins

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw at the front of riser.
customer_reviews.text: We like that it has handles for stability. HOWEVER ... For some reason, urine collects between the bottom of the riser and the actual toilet in the front of the seat. Even though it slightly overlaps the actual toilet, somehow it gets between the 2 spots. That is disgusting!
customer_reviews.author: CLAW

customer_reviews.title: Slides side to side
customer_reviews.text: This unit works for my mom who is unable to sit on low toilet due to recent hip replacement but it does not secure well to toilet. It constantly moves side to side across toilet base. We had to install a grab bar on wall next to toilet for my mom to have better stability since it kept moving.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Davis

customer_reviews.title: Works like its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for a slim person. It was easy to assemble, a little difficult to install(not hard per say, just a few difficulties with the screws). This is not a good seat for men over size 34 or women over size 12. Wiping your arse, will be difficult if you are a bit larger.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Guinn

customer_reviews.title: This has saved me a lot of pain and problem ...
customer_reviews.text: This has saved me a lot of pain and problem after my knee replacement surgery. It's a bit higher than most of these .Less costly than at the medical equipment store here. Leaving it on for use after my other knee gets replaced in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: W. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Safe, secure seating
customer_reviews.text: I only needed this item for two weeks, as I had to recover from knee surgery. It was very helpful, as our seat is a lower standard size. We then cleaned, sanitized, and donated to facility in need.
customer_reviews.author: Sallygirl

customer_reviews.title: Great For Post-Op Foot Surgery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was non weight bearing on my left foot following foot surgery. I already had a handicap toilet in my master bath (just because I am tall). Let me say if you are over six feet tall, a handicap toilet is not enough if you are transferring from a scooter or walker on only one foot. This product is excellent and gives you the extra height which is very helpful. In addition the attached arms are a huge plus. Installation was easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install. Perfect for seniors and hip/knee patients.
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for seniors or people who had hip/knee surgery patients. The only downfall of item is that it collects urine between the seat and toilet bowl, which smells. To clean between it you have to uninstall, clean and then install it back on. No way of lifting it up, you can push it to the sides to clean/wipe, but have to be super careful that it doesn’t get lose. Tighten it afterwards so no one falls when trying to sit on it.
customer_reviews.author: NB

product_meta.title: Essential Medical Supply Elevated Toilet Seat with Arms, Elongated, 19.5 x 14 x 3.5 Inch
product_meta.description: Style:WITH ARMS| Size:19.5 x 14 x 3.5 InchThe elevated toilet seat with arms gives the user the elevation of a standard toilet seat but still allows them to use their own seat. Padded, removable arms make it more secure when getting on or off the commode. Available in standard and elongated sizes and include all hardware. User weight limit - 300 pounds Easy To Install Via Long Bolts And Wing Nuts
feature_bullets: Arms make it easier to get on and off
Wipes down easily. Elongated bowl approximately 19.5 inch long and 14 inch wide and 3.5 inch tall
Removable Arms Provide Support While Sitting Down Or Getting Up

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
